repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: The Nīticāram, “The gist of moral teachings”, also named Nīticākaram in the manuscript, that is, a collection moral or didactic stanzas. An incomplete copy (the text stops abruptly in U2, f49v4) in 74 stanzas, with gaps. Each stanza is followed by its commentary.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (October 2020 and March 2022).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation for U2 and U3 only.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Statement to user. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = Nīticāram: Invocation. Tamil foliation 1. Verso blank.
29 folios = Nīticāram: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-17, 26-37. Bundle disordered at the time of examination (2020/10): the succession of folios was then 1-17, 27-29, 26, 30-37.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation. No boreholes. Upper right edge of last 2 folios truncated.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 columns for U3: text in the left column, ending with Etu, commentary in the left column, ending with verse numbering. User-friendly manuscript. Stanzas distributed aṭi-wise per line and final letter(s) indented to the right at the end of lines.

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson (1868) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1845 as described in Velanguani Arokium (1845).

provenance.p: Unknown. Possibly an Ariel manuscript not acknowledged as such. See the woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF like for other Ariel manuscripts. There is however no BnF donation sticker like like for other Ariel manuscripts.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
